alert.note: Alert for Cloud; Ottawa; Republic (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 07 at 6:34AM CDT until April 07 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 008, 020, AND 034... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 008, 020, AND 034... The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * WIND...Northwest wind 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph today. Northwest winds continue Friday between 15 and 25 mph with gusts around 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...25 to 35 percent through mid-day today. 17 to 22 percent Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid outdoor burning. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
